metanodes.Gene: Protein-coding human genes from Entrez Gene
metanodes.Compound: Approved small molecule compounds with documented chemical structures from DrugBank
metanodes.Disease: Complex diseases from the Disease Ontology. Selected to be distinct and specific enough to be clinically relevant yet general enough to be well annotated.
metanodes.Symptom: Signs and Symptoms (i.e. clinical abnormalities that can indicate a medical condition) from the MeSH Ontology
metanodes.Biological Process: Larger processes or biological programs accomplished by multiple molecular activities. From Gene Ontology.
metanodes.Cellular Component: The locations relative to cellular structures in which a gene product performs a function. From Gene Ontology.
metanodes.Molecular Function: activities that occur at the molecular level, such as "catalysis" or "transport". From Gene Ontology.
metanodes.Pathway: A series of actions among molecules in a cell that leads to a certain product or change in the cell. From WikiPathways, Reactome, and Pathway Interaction Database.
metanodes.Pharmacologic Class: "Chemical/Ingredient", "Mechanism of Action", and "Physiologic Effect" FDA class types from DrugCentral

common.license: The license governing usage of the information as per its source database

nodes.name: The name of the node
nodes.identifier: The identifier for accessing the node from its particular source
nodes.source: The database from which the node and its properties were gathered
nodes.class_type: The FDA class type of the pharmacologic class
nodes.chromosome: Which chromosome the gene is on
nodes.inchi: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) for the compound
nodes.inchikey: A condensed representation of the InChI
nodes.bto_id: The BRENDA Tissue Ontology (BTO) identifier for the node
nodes.mesh_id: The Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) identifier for the node

edges.source: The database from which the edge and its properties were gathered
